title: Missed MEV blocks when DB is being flushed

body:
Just as an addition, the database seems to be constantly growing and pruning doesn't reduce its size.
We have three instances, they have 3.8G, 873M, 69M databases. First one after 20 minutes of pruning wasn't done, second one took 4-5 minutes and then it started correctly, but didn't decrease its size (I would've expected to shrink up to the 3rd instance size)

@0xalex88 -- Unfortunately, boltdb is not able to release allocated space back to the disk once it has been allocated. It does free up some space for storage and will use that but the total size on disk will only increase and never decrease. When you prune the db, it may "free" 1gb which can be overwritten but the on disk size will remain the same. The only way to truly shrink the disk space footprint is to iterate over the whole db and write to a new database.

See: https://github.com/boltdb/bolt/issues/423
@prestonvanloon oh that's good to know! thanks
@0xalex88 I think we have root caused this correctly and solved this in v4.0.7. If this is not the case for you, I will reopen the issue.
